title: A Complete Guide to the Google Translate Extension

steps.title: Go to the Chrome Web Store.
steps.content: Go to the Chrome Web Store. Visit the Chrome Store with your PC.

steps.title: Download the extension.
steps.content: Download the extension. Find Google Translate from the results and click on ADD TO CHROME .

steps.title: Done.
steps.content: Done. Now you can see the extension's icon on the browser.

steps.title: Highlight the words you want to translate.
steps.content: Highlight the words you want to translate.

steps.title: Click on the Google Translate icon.
steps.content: Click on the Google Translate icon.

steps.title: Try translating text in other ways.
steps.content: Try translating text in other ways. Highlight the words and click on the extension icon from the bar. Click on the extension icon from the bar, paste the words, and click Translate . Select the words, right-click on it, and click Google Translate .

steps.title: Done.
steps.content: Done. Now you can see the words in your own language. You can also change the language.

steps.title: Open Google Translate's extension options.
steps.content: Open Google Translate's extension options. Right-click on the extension's icon and select Options from there.

steps.title: Change primary language.
steps.content: Change primary language. Click on the "My primary language" box and select your language on from the drop down list.

steps.title: Change pop-up translations.
steps.content: Change pop-up translations. Select an option: Display icon that you can click to show pop-ups. Immediately display pop-ups. Any text selected in your Chrome browser gets sent to the Google server to determine if a translation should be displayed. Don't display icons or pop-ups. You can still translate selected text by clicking the Google Translate extension icon.

steps.title: Click Save to save the settings.
steps.content: Click Save to save the settings.
